meanings.definition: In a way that relates to the beauty or appearance of something.
meanings.sent1: The flowers were arranged esthetically in the vase.
meanings.sent2: The painting was hung esthetically on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to balance esthetically on the narrow ledge.
meanings.sent4: The sunlight filtered through the leaves, creating an esthetically pleasing pattern on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully plated the dish, ensuring it looked esthetically pleasing to the diners.

meanings.definition: In a way that is visually pleasing or attractive.
meanings.sent1: The new building was designed esthetically with modern lines and colors.
meanings.sent2: The garden was landscaped esthetically with a variety of flowers and shrubs.
meanings.sent3: The clown's outfit was esthetically mismatched, causing laughter in the audience.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline at night was esthetically illuminated by the lights of the buildings.
meanings.sent5: The jewelry sparkled esthetically under the bright lights of the store.
